observation: Seaham Town Council - Home  Home Latest News Press Releases Seaham Newsletters Our Environmental Initiatives The Council The Mayor Find Your Council Representatives Your Councilliors Meetings Responsibilities & Services Strategic Documents Local Government Transparency Council Policies Councillor Information Packs Annual Accounts Privacy Policy Information Places of Interest Seaham Town Hall Gallery Historic Seaham Twin Town Gerlingen Useful Links Non-Emergency Services Schools Sports Clubs Health Provision Transport Links More ... Events Contact Us In the Cold Short Days of January Help Celebrate Everything Positive About Seaham 17 January 2024 News Read More Dog Bag Distribution in Seaham 17 November 2023 Seaham Town Council Environmental Sustainability 21 July 2021 All Stars Cricket 16 April 2024 Seaham Wins Best Coastal Resort 22 September 2023 Reclaiming our Seas 10 October 2022 Destination Seaham Group Read our Latest Newsletter 11 March 2024 Fundraise and Recycle Bin Council Offers Free Litterpicking Equipment Welcome to the Seaham Town Council Website Seaham Town Council’s website which is designed to provide information about the town and the many amenities which make it an excellent place to live and work. With an expanding population of circa 21,500, Seaham is located in the north east of England with stunning cliff top views over the harbour. It is a coastal town in County Durham (the land of the Prince Bishops), 12 miles east of Durham City and 6 miles south of Sunderland. Seaham’s popular North beach, with its sea washed sand and rock pools has been greatly enhanced by a fine, long sea wall which also protects the crumbling cliffs and Coast Road. There are numerous view points on the cliff tops and picnic areas at Seaham Hall, St. Mary the Virgin Church, Noses Point and the Port of Seaham. Within the town there is ample free car parking. Upcoming Events Audience of Mediumship - Friday, 5th July, 2024 Disco Evening Every week from Monday, 23 October 2023 at 18:00 - 21:00. £5 per person In Your Face Theatre - Oliver Jr Seaham Town Hall. Tuesday, 30th April - Saturday, 4th May, 2024. Armed Forces Day - Saturday, 29th June, 2024 Seaham Town Park. 12pm-6pm Dynamique Arts Show Details to follow. Week commencing 10th June 2024. Seaham Carnival Terrace Green/Church Street. Saturday 13th & Sunday 14th July, 2024. In Your Face Theatre - Little Shop of Horrors Seaham Town Hall. Tuesday, 17th - Saturday, 21st September, 2024. In Your Face Theatre - Youth Concert Seaham Town Hall. Wednesday, 9th - Friday, 11th October, 2024. Vane Tempest Theatre Group Show Phoenix Productions Pantomime In Your Face Theatre Pantomime Transparency Minutes/Agendas Town Hall Seaham Today Acknowledgements The Town Council wish to acknowledge and record its thanks to the Durham Heritage Coast, the E-Travel Guide, the Seaham Red Star Football Club and the late Mr Tom McNee for the contributions/photographs which have been incorporated within this website. Disclaimer Every effort is made to ensure that all the material on this site is up to date and accurate but we cannot accept responsibility for any loss or damage which may occur from use of the information. If you find anything that concerns you please contact us on the following email info@seaham.gov.uk Copyright Unless otherwise stated, all of these pages are copyright protected. Copyright Seaham Town Council. All rights reserved. Stockton Road, Seaham Co. Durham, SR7 0HP Email: Phone: 0191 581 8034​ Accessibility Statement

There are no immediate red flags such as unusually low prices, offers of free money, exploitation of human psychological weaknesses, or non-existent companies. I should now verify the legitimacy of the council and the website.

thought: The WHOIS information indicates that the domain 'seaham.gov.uk' is registered to the UK Cabinet Office, which is a UK Government Body. The domain has been registered since before August 1996. The absence of any commercial registrar and the association with government entities lend further credibility to the domain being legitimate and not a scam. Given the WHOIS information and the earlier observations, there is enough evidence to determine the legitimacy of the website. I now know the final answer The website https://www.seaham.gov.uk/ is not a scam website.
